clock.paletteHelp: Generates events at regular clock intervals (seconds, minutes, hours, ...).
clock.help:
This node generates events at regular clock intervals. "Day of month", "day of week", "day of year", "month" and "week number" start with "1". The first day of week is monday. An output is generated:

  • On startup
  • On change of "100 ms", "second", "minute" or "hour"
  • On midnight for "dom", "dow", "doy", "week", "month" and "year"

delay.paletteHelp: Forwards an input after a specified amount of time.
delay.help: This node forwards an input after a specified amount of time. The maximum number of queued inputs is 10.

impulse.paletteHelp: Forwards true and after a specified amount of time resets the output to false.
impulse.help: The impulse node forwards true and resets the output to false after a specified amount of time. An input of a single true or false is ignored while the timer is running. A false, true sequence while the timer is running restarts it. This behavior is changed by selecting Allow retrigger. When this option is enabled a true after a true is not ignored.

interval.input1Description: Set to true to enable the timer and to false to disable it.
interval.input2Description: Set to true to reset the timer. Setting EN to false also resets the timer.
interval.output1Description: Outputs the number of ticks since the timer was started.
interval.output2Description: Outputs true when the timer is finished after the time defined in "Reset after" is up.
interval.paletteHelp: Generates an periodic event in constant intervals.
interval.help: This node generates events in constant intervals. Set EN to "true" to enable the timer. You can set "Reset after" to automatically disable the timer. When the timer is stopped after the time defined in "Reset after", output f is set to "true".

off-delay.input1Description: A boolean input. The timer is set when false is input and reset when input is set to true.
off-delay.input2Description: A boolean input resetting the timer to it's start value. When the last input was false, the timer continues running.
off-delay.output1Description: Outputs true when input is set to true. Outputs false when timer reaches 0.
off-delay.output2Description: Outputs the time left before setting output "o" to false.
off-delay.paletteHelp:
Output is set to true, when input is true. If the input is set to false, the output stays true until the configured time is over. The timer is reset when the input is set to true and restarted when it is set to false again.

When the delay is left unconfigured, it can be set with $message['delay'].
off-delay.help: Output is set to true, when input is true. If the input is set to false, the output stays true until the configured time is over. The timer is reset when the input is set to true and restarted when it is set to false again.

on-delay.input1Description: A boolean input. The timer is set when true is input and reset when input is set to false.
on-delay.input2Description: A boolean input resetting the timer to it's start value. When the last input was true, the timer continues running.
on-delay.output1Description: Outputs false when input is set to false. Outputs true when timer reaches 0.
on-delay.output2Description: Outputs the time left before setting output "o" to true.
on-delay.paletteHelp:
When the input is set to true, the output stays false until the configured delay time. If the delay time is over, the output is set to true. If the input is set to false, the output is set to false immediately.

When the delay is left unconfigured, it can be set with $message['delay'].
on-delay.help: When the input is set to true, the output stays false until the configured delay time. If the delay time is over, the output is set to true. If the input is set to false, the output is set to false immediately.

ramp-to.input2Description: Set current value. You don't need to worry about feedback loops here.
ramp-to.output1Description: Outputs the current value every step interval. The value is only output, when it changed.
ramp-to.output2Description: Outputs true when the ramping up starts and false when it stopped.
ramp-to.output3Description: Outputs true when the ramping down starts and false when it stopped.

rate-limiter.help: This node rate limits incoming messages. You can specify the maximum number of incoming messages that are forwarded within interval. The last message is stored and always forwarded at the end. By unchecking "Output during first interval", the node waits for "interval" until the first message is output.

slow-pwm.output1Description: Outputs "true" on high and "false" on low value.
slow-pwm.help: This node generates a slow PWM signal. Input the duty cycle lenght to D. Set Period to the period in seconds. The minimum period is 10 seconds, the duty cycle resolution is 1 second. Set EN to false to disable the PWM. When disabled the node outputs false. At least one message it output every dutycycle.

sun-position.help: This node ouputs the current azimuth and altitude every minute. The output type is struct with the keys azimuth and altitude.
sun-position.output1Description: Outputs a struct with the keys azimuth and altitude.

timer.input1Description: Set to false to disable the timer and to true to enable it again. By default the timer is enabled.
timer.input2Description: Set to HH:MM:[SS] to dynamically set the timer's "On time" overwriting the value from the setting dialog.
timer.input3Description: Set to HH:MM:[SS] to dynamically set the timer's "Off time" overwriting the value from the setting dialog.
timer.help:
This node generates events at specific time points. For the "sunlight times" to work, "Latitude" and "Longitude" must be specified. "On offset" and "Off offset" (in minutes) are added to "On time" and "Off time". Make sure the time and time zone settings of the computer running the flow are correct.

Sunlight Times

sunrise
sunrise (top edge of the sun appears on the horizon)
sunriseEnd
sunrise ends (bottom edge of the sun touches the horizon)
goldenHourEnd
morning golden hour (soft light, best time for photography) ends
solarNoon
solar noon (sun is in the highest position)
goldenHour
evening golden hour starts
sunsetStart
sunset starts (bottom edge of the sun touches the horizon)
sunset
sunset (sun disappears below the horizon, evening civil twilight starts)
dusk
dusk (evening nautical twilight starts)
nauticalDusk
nautical dusk (evening astronomical twilight starts)
night
night starts (dark enough for astronomical observations)
nadir
nadir (darkest moment of the night, sun is in the lowest position)
nightEnd
night ends (morning astronomical twilight starts)
nauticalDawn
nautical dawn (morning nautical twilight starts)
dawn
dawn (morning nautical twilight ends, morning civil twilight starts)

timer2.input1Description: Set to false to disable the timer and to true to enable it again. By default the timer is enabled.
timer2.input2Description: Set to HH:MM:[SS] to dynamically set the timer's "On time" overwriting the value from the setting dialog.
timer2.input3Description: Set to HH:MM:[SS] to dynamically set the timer's "Off time" overwriting the value from the setting dialog.
timer2.help:
This node generates events at specific time points. For the "sunlight times" to work, "Latitude" and "Longitude" must be specified. "On offset" and "Off offset" (in minutes) are added to "On time" and "Off time". Make sure the time and time zone settings of the computer running the flow are correct.

Sunlight Times

sunrise
sunrise (top edge of the sun appears on the horizon)
sunriseEnd
sunrise ends (bottom edge of the sun touches the horizon)
goldenHourEnd
morning golden hour (soft light, best time for photography) ends
solarNoon
solar noon (sun is in the highest position)
goldenHour
evening golden hour starts
sunsetStart
sunset starts (bottom edge of the sun touches the horizon)
sunset
sunset (sun disappears below the horizon, evening civil twilight starts)
dusk
dusk (evening nautical twilight starts)
nauticalDusk
nautical dusk (evening astronomical twilight starts)
night
night starts (dark enough for astronomical observations)
nadir
nadir (darkest moment of the night, sun is in the lowest position)
nightEnd
night ends (morning astronomical twilight starts)
nauticalDawn
nautical dawn (morning nautical twilight starts)
dawn
dawn (morning nautical twilight ends, morning civil twilight starts)

weekly-program.input1Description: Set to false to disable the node and to true to enable it again. By default the node is enabled.
weekly-program.help: This node generates events at specific time points.
